meanings.definition: Involving or relating to all members of a group or category.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a generalized explanation that everyone could understand.
meanings.sent2: The idea of being kind is a generalized concept that applies to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's generalized curiosity led it to explore every corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a generalized ray of sunshine, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's advice was so generalized that it could apply to any patient.

meanings.sent1: The new technology became a generalized tool used by everyone.
meanings.sent2: The fashion trend quickly became generalized among the youth.
meanings.sent3: The joke became so generalized that even the pets seemed to understand it.
meanings.sent4: His influence was like a generalized ripple, reaching far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers became a generalized fragrance in the garden.

meanings.sent1: She provided a generalized overview of the project without going into specifics.
meanings.sent2: The report only contained generalized information about the topic.
meanings.sent3: His directions were so generalized that we ended up lost in the city.
meanings.sent4: The painting depicted a generalized scene of nature without focusing on any particular element.
meanings.sent5: The speech was so generalized that it failed to address any real issues.
